docs.lead_paragraph: Being vaccinated against a disease protects everyone else through herd immunity.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by internist Steven L Weinreb laments that the vaccination rates for many diseases in Europe and parts of the United States are falling; argues that being vaccinated against a disease protects everyone else through herd immunity.
docs.snippet: Being vaccinated against a disease protects everyone else through herd immunity.

docs.lead_paragraph: With Medicare set to start reimbursing physicians for obesity treatment in January, a new campaign is directing ads both at patients and at physicians.

headline.seo: A Campaign to Draw Doctors to a Weight-Loss Program
headline.main: Enticing Doctors to Endorse a Weight-Loss Program
headline.print_headline: Enticing Doctors to Endorse a Weight-Loss Program

docs.abstract: Andrew Adam Newman Advertising column observes that with Medicare set to start reimbursing physicians for obesity treatment in January, a new campaign is directing ads both at patients and at doctors.
docs.snippet: With Medicare set to start reimbursing physicians for obesity treatment in January, a new campaign is directing ads both at patients and at physicians.

docs.lead_paragraph: The life expectancy for babies born in New York City reached 80.6 years in 2009, the highest level recorded and one that surpasses the national life expectancy rate, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said Tuesday.

headline.main: New Yorkers' Life Expectancy Reaches 80.6 Years, Higher Than National Rate

docs.abstract: Being born in New York City increases a child's chances of having a long life.
docs.snippet: Being born in New York City increases a child's chances of having a long life.
